title.narrative: STRENGTHENING CONSERVATION OF PRIORITY CRANE HABITATS IN ASIA

description.narrative: To extend Forest Service efforts to improve forest policies and practices internationally, address climate change, conserve and protect critical global forest environments and resources, and improve the lives of forest-dependent peoples by awarding grants to and entering into cooperative agreements with nonprofit organizations, multilateral organizations, and other individuals, organizations, institutions, and governments engaged in forest conservation and management.

title.narrative: Technical and Policy Discussion on Prevention and Containment of H5N1 Highly-Pathogenic Avian Influenza in Highly Affected and Neighboring Countries

description.narrative: A U.S. Government delegation attended a Technical and Policy Discussion on Prevention and Containment of H5N1 Highly-Pathogenic Avian Influenza in Highly Affected and Neighboring Countries in Ho Chi Minh City, April 23, 2012. The APHIS Southeast Asia Regional representative from Bangkok, Thailand, represented APHIS at the event in Vietnam.

person-name.narrative: Daniel Herche and Tyson Whitney; Ryan Boles

transaction.usg:treasury-account: Animal and Plant Health Inspection Service, Salaries and Expenses
Animal and Plant Health Inspection Service, Salaries and Expenses

description.narrative: APHIS delivered a training workshop on the Irradiation Preclearance Program in Vietnam. During the week of November 27, APHIS Preclearance and Offshore Programs conducted a training workshop in Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam on the preclearance program and offshore irradiation treatment for plant products imported into the United States from Vietnam. A total of 30 participants attended and included candidates selected by the Vietnam Ministry of Agriculture to represent Vietnams Plant Protection Department). This intensive, four-day course emphasized topics in fundamentals of irradiation, guidelines and regulations pertaining to irradiation phytosanitary treatment, roles and responsibilities as per the operational work plan, and use of the Irradiation Reporting and Accountability Database (IRADS). It also included hands-on technical training with on-site visits regarding monitoring responsibilities at irradiation facilities, production sites and packinghouses. The workshop was a joint effort and involved extensive collaboration with representatives from APHIS, USDA's Foreign Agricul

person-name.narrative: Daniel Herche and Tyson Whitney; Ryan Boles

transaction.usg:treasury-account: Animal and Plant Health Inspection Service, Agricultural Quarantine Inspection User Fee Account
Animal and Plant Health Inspection Service, Agricultural Quarantine Inspection User Fee Account

description.narrative: APHIS participated in a clinical presentation on African Swine Fever (ASF) and appropriate methods for conducting a premises investigation. This presentation included guidelines for personal protective equipment and application of quantitative epidemiologic principles to conduct an outbreak investigation. Additionally, the presentation will demonstrate proper animal restraint and euthanasia techniques; necropsy techniques for swine with an emphasis on sample collection and submission procedures; appropriate methods of animal disposal; and premises cleaning/disinfection and restocking methods. The classroom presentation is followed by field evaluations by the experts on Vietnams ASF response efforts, swine farm operations, and laboratory capacities. The course concluded with the experts sharing its assessment with the Vietnamese authorities to recommend ASF follow-up actions to address Vietnams needs.

activity-date.narrative: Date unavailable. Calculated start date is the earliest transaction date

person-name.narrative: Daniel Herche and Tyson Whitney; Ryan Boles

transaction.usg:treasury-account: Animal and Plant Health Inspection Service, Salaries and Expenses

title.narrative: African Swine Fever (ASF) Response in Vietnam Train-the-Trainer and 3D Response Personnel Training

description.narrative: In order to design a training program that met the needs of Vietnam, additional site visits and meetings with officials were necessary. These activities are proposed as Phase 1 of a comprehensive training program. Meetings with officials identified the most appropriate audience for both train-the-trainer programs and trainings with provincial and district emergency response personnel. Additionally, these meetings helped determine the size of the audience, number of programs, and best locations for the events. Site visits helped the team understand the full range of depopulation, disposal and decontamination practices currently being implemented. Depopulation Subject Matter Experts (SMEs) on the team observed all depopulation equipment and methods currently being used in Vietnam to manage the ASF outbreak. Disposal SMEs should investigate all disposal methods in a wide variety of geographic and hydrologic settings.

title.narrative: Scientific Cooperation Research Program - Feed Formulation

description.narrative: The Scientific Cooperation Research Program supports joint research, extension, and education projects lasting up to two years among domestic and international agricultural professionals. These projects address issues including agricultural trade and market access, animal and plant health, biotechnology, food safety and security, and sustainable natural resource management.

Foreign Agricultural Service, Salaries and Expenses

description.narrative: The Faculty Exchange Program enhances the teaching ability of agricultural educators from institutions of higher learning in developing countries. Participants come to the United States for one academic semester (4-5 months) to increase their knowledge of, and ability to teach, agricultural economics, marketing, business and law in a market-based economy.
